answerText: morpholinos[10] Morpholinos are commonly used to study development in this organism, which is a convenient choice since its embryos are transparent. This aquatic organism's scientific name is Danio rerio.
heading: DRAGOON |2013 | 4 | 9 | Science | Biology | College
subject: Science
question: Question: Designed by James Summerton, these molecules are a commonly used tool to facilitate gene knockdown. [10] Name these antisense oligomers which bind to a target site on RNA, blocking cellular processes from acting on the target site.
